29 Nov 2017

Matcha Red Bean Moon Cake

Matcha and Red Bean! Yummy!

Ingredients:

White kidney bean stuffing:

  • white kidney beans 180 grams
  • fine sugar 125 grams
  • butter 65 grams

Matcha moon cake skin:

  • white kidney bean paste 170 grams
  • Matcha tea powder 1 gram
  • milk powder 5 grams
  • butter 10 grams
  • low-gluten flour 25 grams
  • a little water

Matcha red bean stuffing: 

  • white kidney bean paste 240 grams
  • Matcha tea powder 2.5 grams
  • honey red beans 60 grams

Cooking Steps

  1. The first step it to make the white Kidney bean stuffing. Soak the white kidney beans in a pot overnight with enough water to cover the beans. For those of you in a rush, boil the beans on low heat for 25-30 minutes then let cool.

  2. Next we will peel the skin off the beans. Transfer the beans to a blender, add the granulated sugar, and add two to three table spoons of water. Blend until smooth (2-3 minutes) then pour into a pan to start the frying process.

  3. Cook on medium low heat while adding the butter gradually. Cook until the butter is fully incorporated into the mixture.

  4. Turn the heat to medium and reduce the mixture till it starts to thicken. It is highly recommended to us a heat-resistant silicone scraper instead of a spatula to mix. The scraper can reach the edges of the pan more easily.

  5. Here you can see the consistency is changing.

  6. Once the stuffing has been reduced to a soft but thick paste like the image above, you can remove from the heat onto a plate to cool.

  7. To cool the stuffing faster, place as shown above. Do not use the white bean paste until it has been completely cooled.

  8. In a large bowl, mix the white kidney bean paste 240 grams, and the 2.5 grams of green tea powder together.

  9. You can adjust the amount of Matcha powder per your own preferences.

  10. Add honey red beans.

  11. Mix well to incorporate the red beans. If it gets too difficult to mix the scraper you can also mix by hand.

  12. Divide the Matcha white bean paste into small parts (approximately 30 grams) and roll into a small balls. The mooncake filling is now complete.

  13. To prepare the mooncake skin, place in a large bowl: 170 grams of the white bean paste, 1 gram of Matcha powder, 5 grams of milk powder, 10 grams of soften butter, and 25 grams of low gluten flour.

  14. Mix the ingredients until it forms a soft dough, add a little water if necessary. To test consistency, take a small piece of dough and flatten it. The dough should not be particularly stick but also should not have cracked edges.

  15. Divide the Moon cake skin mixture into 20 gram portions and roll into balls.

  16. Take a ball of the moon cake skin mixture and flatten with the palm of your hand.

  17. Place a ball of the filling onto the moon cake skin.

  18. Wrap the moon cake skin around the stuffing by slowly pushing it until it covers all the stuffing.

  19. This is what it should look like once it's completely wrapped up.

  20. Placed the wrapped dough into the moon cake mold, you can dust the mold in a light poder of flour if you are worried about sticking.

  21. Place the formed moon cakes on a pan line with parchment paper. Place in a pre-heated 170 ℃ oven and bake for about 12 minutes but ensure that the outside does not toast. You can serve fresh or be stored overnight.
